conclusion: Determine the time it takes for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane after the string breaks when object A hits the ground.
Both objects A and B will accelerate due to gravity with the same acceleration.
The forces acting on object A are gravitational force downward and tension in the string upward.
The forces acting on object B are gravitational force component down the incline and tension in the string up the incline.
Net force on object A is mg - T = ma.
Net force on object B is T - mg sin θ = ma.
Solve the equations to find T = m(g - a).
Substitute T into the second equation to find a = g(1 - sin θ)/2.
Given θ = 37° and sin 37° = 0.6.
Calculate acceleration a = 2 m/s².
Object A falls a distance h = 1 m.
Use kinematic equation v² = u² + 2as to find v = 2 m/s.
Velocity of object B when the string breaks is 2 m/s up the incline.
After the string breaks, object B moves up the incline with initial velocity 2 m/s and decelerates under gravity.
Acceleration down the incline is g sin θ = 6 m/s².
Find time t₁ for object B to come to rest using v = u + at.
Calculate t₁ = 1/3 s.
Find distance d object B travels up the incline using s = ut + 1/2at².
Calculate d = 1/3 m.
Object B slides back down the incline with initial velocity 0 m/s and acceleration 6 m/s².
Find time t₂ to slide back down using s = ut + 1/2at².
Calculate t₂ = 1/3 s.
Total time for object B to return to the bottom is t = t₁ + t₂ = 2/3 s.
